content.description: Start from the jugs in the center of the pyramid and move straight up. To reach the start holds you'll need to stand on the adjacent boulder.
content.protection: 1 pad, but you may want a spotter just in case.

content.description: Start on opposing crimps on the bottom-left end of the arete and fight up to the holds on the left side of the arete. Once you also establish at least one foot on the left side of the arete the climbing eases off. Top-out at the peak of the pyramid.
content.protection: Narrow pad(s) to fit in the narrow landing, or build a suspended floor of driftwood for your pad.
content.location: Left side of the Pyramid Boulder.

content.description: Same start as Sharp Schist Arete, but move right to the center of the face on good crimps upon establishing on the left side of the arete.
content.location: Left side of the Pyramid Boulder.

content.description: Stand start at the bottom center of the pyramid on a good right hand crimp and a left hand tiny sloper crimp. Find your way up to the decent flakes above you and follow up with an easy topout.
content.protection: 1 pad, but you may want a spotter just in case.

content.description: A nearly vertical face with thin holds and a narrow dodgey landing below, as well as a lichen covered arete with a few good holds.
